items.content_html:
Description

Add link for Object.seal() to the introduction paragraph.

Motivation

Because otherwise the user has to scroll all the way to the bottom to #See_Also, or more realistically hit alt-back to Google and scroll to the next search result.

User: "What does Object.isSealed() do?"
Bad answer: "why, it tells you if it's sealed, duh!"
Good answer: "Oh, you want the article on Object.seal(), here you go." //(My thought)
Better answer: "It checks if the object is sealed against extensions or configuration. Details on seals over there, details on that check function down here." //(Thanks, @estelle)
items.title: Add link to Object.seal() in introduction to Object.isSealed()

items.content_html:
rgba() is an alias for rgb().

the example isn't using the legacy syntax of using commas, so i updated the text, title, and live sample function call to remove the "legacy" lingo.
items.title: rgba() is not necessarily legacy.

items.content_html:
Fixes #32705

Not strictly a fix, because IMO the existing text was not broken. But this explains that you can use import with Express/node, why we don't, and points to the docs for more info.
items.title: Explain why the Express tutorial uses require rather than import

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 123/124 includes features required for developers to create cross-document View Transitions. This includes:

  • The PageRevealEvent interface
  • The pagereveal event
  • The PageSwapEvent interface
  • The pageswap event
  • The NavigationActivation interface
  • The @view-transition at rule
  • <link rel="expect">

This PR adds content for all of these. In addition, it:

  • Updates the View Transitions API landing page to cover these new features.
  • Moves the guide content to a separate "Using the View Transitions API" article.
  • Makes some updates to existing view transitions pages, so that they work for SPA and MPA use cases.

Related ChromeStatus entries:

  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5118874666663936
  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5205586941837312
  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5113053598711808

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

  • dom-examples demo: mdn/dom-examples#265
  • BCD: mdn/browser-compat-data#22638
items.title: Document cross-document view transitions

items.content_html:
Description

You cannot use https://threejs.org/build/three.min.js to download three.js anymore. Instead linking to their install docs and some hints for setting up with Node.js. There are three main options at the moment:

  • Node.js (saying this is the preferred method)
  • download the GitHub release artifact (350MB zip)
  • use a CDN for the JS

Additions:

  • Add up-to-date install instructions for three.js

Changes:

  • Link to Three.js tutorial for setup steps in other resources instead of copy pasting.
  • Updating link to Phong Material to https://developer.playcanvas.com/user-manual/assets/types/material/
  • The paid Phaser plugin appears to be gone, linking to the open source version with links to example code.

Removals:

  • Removing https://aframevr.tumblr.com/

Motivation

Keep external links working & install docs up-to-date
items.title: fix(games): Fix broken links to three.js, related 404s

items.content_html:
Description

Add explanation of names attribute of details element.

Motivation

This attribute is listed in the Browser compatibility table below but doesn't come with explanations.

Additional details

The feature related to the attribute is supported in Chrome and Safari since 17.2 (called 'Exclusive accordions'), but not in Firefox yet.

Related issues and pull requests

N/A
items.title: add docs for `name` attribute of `details`

items.content_html:
The exception is also thrown when array length is changed in a same for loop.

Tested on Google Chrome and Brave.
items.title: fix(js): add concurrent modification case to "invalid array length" error page

items.content_html:
Description

Updates the description of the action, browser action, and page action API and manifest keys to make it clear that the manifest key is a requirement to add each of these features to an extension. The API is only available to modify buttons defined in the manifest.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #32627
items.title: Clarify APIs supporting manifest keys

items.content_html:
Description

Describe import('moduleName') behavior when module does not exist

Motivation

  • I wasn't sure if import() would fail asynchronously if the moduleName had a typo or didn't exist. In hindsight, I could've deduced that from the way the text was written, but I thought it might help to be explicit?
  • I tested in node.js and confirmed it will fail asynchronously in this scenario.
  • I'm not sure if this is an overall improvement, but hopefully, worst case scenario, it will give someone an idea of how to iterate on what I wrote.
items.title: Describe `import('moduleName')` behavior when module does not exist

items.content_html:
Fixes #32678

Glitch currently supports up to node 16, and it is quite likely people will be testing on later versions. This explains that you need to modify your node version if higher than 16.

Glitch are planning to fix this, so I have linked to their roadmap and also provided info on how you can work out the current set of node version. In a year or so once they have fixed this we can probably remove this section.
items.title: Add section on how to handle Glitch node limits

items.content_html:
Description

Put quotes on this string like the other strings

Motivation

To match style here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ariaExpanded

Additional details

Spec: https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-hidden

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Clarify ariaHidden with quoted string undefined

items.content_html:
FF125 supports Intl.Segmenter in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1883914.

This removes the FF experimental feature and adds to release note.

Related docs can be tracked in #32661
items.title: FF125 RelNote: Intl.Segmenter supported

items.content_html:
Description

Glossary page: Accessible name

  • Fixes subject-verb mismatches
  • Edits for clarity

Attribute: aria-label

  • Replaces link for "accessible name" to our glossary page
  • Adds a description for the example code
  • Reorganizes multi-para content in "Description" into bullets for better scanning of info
  • Collates repeated info in text and note
  • Adds missing period to note text
  • Other general edits for clarity and readability

Motivation

To improve readability, clarity, and organization

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: fix(aria-label): Improve page for clarity

items.content_html:
Description

Clearer example for MouseEvent#buttons.

Motivation

Current example is both too simple (doesn't indicate how to check if individual mouse buttons are pressed) and too complicated (requires understanding of how HTML text nodes work, an unrelated low-level concept that most JS devs rarely use).

Summary of changes

  • Demonstrate how to check for individual mouse buttons using binary & and powers of two
  • Include the individual mouse buttons in the log output
  • Set HTML element textContent rather than text node data property
  • Remove irrelevant comments

CodePen

Previewable CodePen version
items.title: Clearer example for `MouseEvent#buttons`

items.content_html:
This adds docs for RTCRemoteInboundRtpStreamStats , a stats object/dictionary you can get by iterating a RTCStatsReport.

It is not very exciting. Largely following the same patterns as the other docs.

This shares some common properties with RTCRemoteOutoundRtpStreamStats. There have been some changes to align those.

This is part of the ongoing work to finished RTC stats, which was started in #27028
items.title: RTCRemoteInboundRtpStreamStats - plus alignment with outbound

items.content_html:
Description

Simplify callback, in the MutationObserver example illustrating the usage of attributeFilter & attributeOldValue.

Motivation

I thought the old version had a typo, in userStatusChanged(mutation.target.username, mutation.target.status);, mutation.target.username seems like it should've been mutation.oldValue, though after taking a closer look, this was probably intentional.

While fixing this "typo", I decided the old callback was unnecessary complex -- e.g. the outer switch wasn't doing anything (aside from serving as a future placeholder perhaps) -- so I made it a bit more "to the point". Also seems a tiny bit unusual to have an example that calls functions not provided (userStatusChanged & usernameChanged), this new one is a little easier to modify and begin playing with.

Related issues and pull requests

Old version added in #9737:
https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/9737/files#diff-fc20b9f4adbc6723e9fe01425cea6512399d9a9bd69451d25f8fd6f0b8f92788R144-R170
items.title: Cleaner attributeFilter/attributeOldValue example (MutationObserver)

items.content_html:
Description

Bump actions/labeler from 4 to 5.

The new input: sync-label is added to automatically remove unmatched labels (which is configured in label matching entries)

Motivation

All the actions which is running on Node 16 will be migrated to Node 20. And the actions/labeler@v4 is running on Node 16 which may not be supported in the future.

Related issues and pull requests

downstream PR: mdn/translated-content#18402

testings:

  • system label: yin1999#9
  • Content:Learn label: yin1999#10
  • Content:Firefox label: yin1999#11
  • Content:Other label: yin1999#12
items.title: chore(ci): Bump actions/labeler from 4 to 5

items.title: Detail domain name for hostname

items.content_html:
Description

Add a warning about third-party cookies blocking in Google Chrome.

Motivation

Google Chrome will gradually block third-party cookies for all users in the second half of 2024, so I've added a warning for SameSite=None.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add a warning about third-party cookies blocking in Google Chrome
